title: MI60037: Petroleum And Mineral Trade - Quick Facts
text:
MI60037
Course name | Petroleum And Mineral Trade
Offered by | Mining Engineering
Credits | 3
L-T-P | 3-0-0
Previous Year Grade Distribution
{{{grades}}}
Semester | Autumn

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: National petroleum and mineral policy, reserve production relationship, demand, supply, market structure and price, Investment, uncertainty, risk and ownership. Maritime trade, Product ordering, retailing, delivery and payment models, collusion and embargo in mineral and petroleum market, cartel price, optimal policy determination. Stockpiling and dumping; introduction to commodity future, business finance, insurance, taxation. business values and ethics.
